main event: An unidentified flying object was observed over St. Lawrence Island, Alaska on March 19, 1951.
interesting points: The object was described as round and bright red with no wings or tail., It was observed flying at approximately 200-300 ft altitude and went in and out of a fog bank., The observers tracked the object for about 1-2 minutes before it climbed out of sight., There were no known friendly aircraft in the vicinity at that time., The sighting was classified as a potential unidentified aircraft and evaluations included balloon, aircraft, and astronomical possibilities.
witness description: one officer and two members of the US Army Security Agency
